description: A tomb on the Via Appia south of Rome belonging to Caecilia Metella, a daughter of Metellus Creticus. She was born ca. 100 BC. In 1303 the tomb was incorporated into the Castrum Caetani, serving as the main tower of the fortification.
details: The Barrington Atlas labeled this feature on the map with "Sep. Caecilia Metella" and in the Map-by-Map Directory printed "Cecilia Metella" in the Modern Name / Location column.
